original_title: Operation Yukthiya: Over 2,100 arrests in 24 hours
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); In a swift and coordinated operation dubbed "Yukthia," Sri Lankan authorities apprehended over 2,100 individuals across the island nation within the past 24 hours, dealing a significant blow to drug trafficking and underworld activities.
Notably, detention orders were secured for 12 suspects, while 133 individuals were referred for rehabilitation.
Ganja/Marijuana emerged as the dominant drug seized during the operation, with authorities confiscating a staggering 178 kilograms.
Western Province emerged as the epicenter of the arrests, with a significant portion of the apprehended individuals hailing from the region.
Officials confirmed the arrest of 116 suspects out of the 3340 identified in the databases operated by the Police Special Branch and the Police Narcotics Bureau.
Furthermore, the operation, launched just yesterday, forms part of a broader initiative dubbed "Justice," aimed at comprehensively suppressing drug trafficking and underworld operations.
The ongoing crackdown benefits from the combined efforts of the Sri Lankan Police, including its Narcotics Bureau and Special Bureau, alongside the Armed Forces and the Police Special Task Force.

A robust deployment of personnel underscores the seriousness of the operation, with 200 army personnel, 200 police officers, and 50 members of the elite Police Special Task Force actively engaged in the nationwide sweep.
